item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, December 13, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. A new video captures a 1968 demo of IBM’s Executive Terminal (78 points | 12 comments)
2. Show HN: DataFuel.dev – Turn websites into LLM-ready data (25 points | 5 comments)
3. A transformer supply crisis bottlenecks energy projects (14 points | 4 comments)
4. Gukesh becomes the youngest chess world champion in history (907 points | 370 comments)
5. Elixir/Erlang Hot Swapping Code (2016) (112 points | 59 comments)
6. Clio: A system for privacy-preserving insights into real-world AI use (8 points | 1 comment)
7. Mathematicians uncover a new way to count prime numbers (23 points | 3 comments)
8. Taming LLMs – A Practical Guide to LLM Pitfalls with Open Source Software (82 points | 12 comments)
9. Fixing the Loading in Myst IV: Revelation (7 points | discuss)
10. Fermat's Last Theorem – how it's going (284 points | 131 comments)
11. Refactoring in C++: Top Techniques and Best Practices (21 points | 7 comments)
12. Timemap.org – Interactive Map of History (810 points | 133 comments)
13. Misperception of the facial appearance that the opposite-sex desires (67 points | 39 comments)
14. Microsoft Discontinues iMac Rival Surface Studio 2 (19 points | 6 comments)
15. A new timeline for Neanderthal interbreeding with modern humans (44 points | 20 comments)
16. Scrabble star wins Spanish world title despite not speaking Spanish (72 points | 49 comments)
17. Unexpected Keyboard (163 points | 76 comments)
18. Trinity Desktop Environment (TDE) (54 points | 20 comments)
19. Learning Tibetan changed the way I think (2023) (49 points | 21 comments)
20. A room temperature Li2O-based lithium-air battery enabled by a solid electrolyte (79 points | 34 comments)
21. Canada euthanasia now accounts for nearly one in 20 deaths (373 points | 656 comments)
22. Converting untrusted PDFs into trusted ones: The Qubes Way (2013) (85 points | 30 comments)
23. Bitbanging 1D Reversible Automata (69 points | 11 comments)
24. Show HN: Lfi – a lazy functional sync, async, and concurrent iteration library (62 points | 16 comments)
25. Show HN: Quantus – LeetCode for Financial Modeling (228 points | 48 comments)
26. Rust's Incremental Compiler Architecture (9 points | discuss)
27. Carta is making it too difficult to cancel subscriptions, some founders say (168 points | 55 comments)
28. Great Question (YC W21) Is Hiring People Operations Manager ( | hide)
29. The secret life of DNS packets (2019) (42 points | 5 comments)
30. Exploring Commercial Products for the NES Expansion Port (39 points | 17 comments)
